item.title: Concerns over abortion, vasectomies, IVF, gender-affirming care access as Catholic organisation Calvary buys Hobart Private
item.description: The operator of the Hobart Private Hospital has agreed to sell the facility to Catholic healthcare provider Calvary, leading to concerns about access to surgical abortions, vasectomies and some other legal procedures.

item.title: England skipper Ben Stokes defends his team as Jofra Archer ruled out of Ashes
item.description: England's disastrous Ashes tour has received another blow with Jofra Archer ruled out of the remaining two Tests while skipper Ben Stokes has dug in to defend his beleaguered team.

item.title: Alice Springs veteran Geoffrey Shaw remembered as tireless advocate for Aboriginal rights
item.description: Alice Springs war veteran Geoffrey Shaw OAM has been remembered as a tireless advocate for Indigenous rights in Central Australia, who leaves a legacy of courage and service.

item.title: Bomb-making list, firearms, extremist flags seized from Perth man accused of backing Bondi attackers
item.description: Police found a bomb-making shopping list when they searched the home of a man who allegedly posted on social media that he supported the gunmen behind the Bondi terror attack, a Perth court has heard.

item.title: Even in the markets, it's beginning to look like Christmas
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: US and Ukraine reach consensus on key issues to end war with Russia but territorial disputes remain
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Ukraine has reached consensus with the US on key issues to end the war with Russia but sensitive issues around territorial control, along with the management of a nuclear power plant, still remain unresolved.

item.title: Christmas quiz: How well do you know traditional Christmas carols?
item.description: Do you know your Merry Gentlemen from you Three Kings? Your Dancers from your Prancers?

item.title: Rental Family offers connection in an increasingly polarised world
item.description: Academy Award-winner Brendan Fraser speaks to ABC News about his new film and why human connection is the antidote to an increasingly polarised world.

item.title: Gaza's remaining Christians mark Christmas with subdued celebrations
item.description: The small number of Christians remaining in Gaza have marked Christmas early with subdued celebrations in the shadow of ongoing conflict and occupation.

item.title: How political divides are putting more pressure on Australian couples
item.description: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

item.title: What you need to know before you buy lab-grown versus natural diamonds
item.description: Diamonds are generally considered a luxury asset that holds its value, but the emergence of laboratory-grown diamonds in the jewellery industry over recent years could challenge that belief.

item.title: Second-hand shopping is a sustainable alternative, but could it be fuelling consumption?
item.description: The rising popularity of second-hand and vintage fashion has been viewed as an opportunity to reduce fast fashion consumption; however, Australia remains one of the world's highest waste producers.

item.title: She readies for a 23rd Sydney to Hobart as the crew honours late owner Peter Rodgers
item.description: A fellowship of sailors will embark on She's 23rd Sydney to Hobart campaign. As they do they will honour one of the most resilient boats in the race's history and remember late owner Peter Rodgers.

item.title: Aged care centre confronts racism, improves staff retention with cultural celebrations
item.description: In 2024 a nurse reported racist abuse from some residents and family members. A year later, instances of abuse have plummeted and staff say it is because of a new program promoting respect.

item.title: White House orders US forces to focus on 'quarantine' of Venezuelan oil, official says
item.description: The White House has ordered US military forces to focus almost exclusively on enforcing the "quarantine" of Venezuelan oil, a US official says.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Grant expected to remain category one system as it passes Cocos (Keeling) Islands
item.description: Tropical Cyclone Grant is expected to remain a category one system as it passes just to the north of the Cocos (Keeling) Islands off the West Australian coast.

item.title: Australia's 'outback fashion capital' promotes healing through fashion
item.description: Almost three years ago, a region in Western Australia's far north was devastated by once-in-a-century floods. Now fashion is stepping in, to heal scars and promote confidence.

item.title: Analogue camera technicians with decades of experience retiring amid boom in film photography
item.description: As film photography surges in popularity among younger generations, technicians who repair analogue cameras are retiring, raising concerns it will become a dying art.

item.title: Nick Bolkus, long-time Labor senator and Hawke-Keating-era minister, dies aged 75
item.description: Nick Bolkus, the long-time Labor senator who played an influential role in shaping Australia's migration policy under prime minister Paul Keating, has died aged 75.

item.title: Public assemblies banned for 14 days across Sydney as police enforce new powers under protest laws
item.description: The NSW Police Commissioner, Mal Lanyon, has activated new powers prescribed under changes to NSW protest laws sparked by the terrorist attack at Bondi Beach on December 14.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Australia leaves out a spinner in all-pace bowling attack for MCG Test
item.description: With up to 10mm of grass on the MCG pitch, Australia has opted for a bold and historic option and left out offspinner Todd Murphy.

item.title: 'Scandinavian sleep method' could help your bad sleep
item.description: This arrangement allows couples to continue sleeping together while meeting each person's individual needs.

item.title: Multiple bushfires threaten homes north and south of Perth, triggering power outages
item.description: Several bushfires burning north and south of Perth have caused major power blackouts, including the entire town of Margaret River.

item.description: Storms hit south-east Queensland on Christmas Day afternoon, knocking out power to thousands of homes.

item.title: Pope Leo decries conditions in Gaza during Christmas Day speech
item.description: During his Urbi et Orbi (city and world) speech on Christmas Day, Pope Leo XIV has called for an end to all wars and for people to think about the conditions in Gaza.

item.title: The marathon mums competing in the Olympics and breaking records postpartum
item.description: For decades, pregnancy was seen as an "injury" that could end a career. But now, determination and growing industry support are seeing marathon-running mothers reach new heights after giving birth.

item.description: The soaring mercury has you craving the cool, dark sanctuary of the cinema. But what to see? The art-house awards-season hopeful? The psychological book adaptation? The one with the big snake?

item.title: Gamba grass risks star attractions in NT's beloved Litchfield National Park
item.description: Much-loved by locals and bringing in more than 250,000 visitors a year, Litchfield National Park has become one of the Northern Territory's star attractions. But it's under threat from a near-invisible invader.

item.title: Shield and First Guardian raise the question, who pays when super funds collapse?
item.description: Thousands of First Guardian investors were dealt another devastating blow when it was revealed just $1.6 million had been recovered from the almost $450 million invested in the collapsed fund. Who will end up paying investors back their lost retirement savings?

item.description: Preparations are underway for the arrival of the deadly H5 strain of bird flu in the Australian Antarctic Territory, as scientists gather baseline population data so they can measure potential deaths among wildlife.

item.description: More women of all ages are signing up to play cricket in regional Victoria.

item.title: Boxing Day Test more than just cricket for descendant of Australia's First XI Aboriginal team

item.description: Police say two holidaymakers are lucky to be alive after being rescued from the cold waters of Port Phillip, south-west of Melbourne, on Christmas Day.

item.title: Harry Brook's on the attack, Cameron Green runs himself out and Josh Tongue cashes in — quick hits from Boxing Day at the MCG
item.description: A record crowd for cricket at the MCG saw another fast-forward day of Ashes action as calamitous run outs and wild Bazball batting took centre stage. Here are the quick hits from the Ashes.

item.title: Australia's batting headaches masked again by dismal English failure on wild Ashes Boxing Day
item.description: Australia's batting order is unsettled, unbalanced and out of form, but it matters little as England throws in the towel and considers the challenge of a Boxing Day Ashes Test all too hard.

item.title: Zelenskyy plans to meet with Trump as peace plan with Russia inches closer
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is planning to meet with US President Donald Trump on Sunday to search for ways to end the war with Russia.

item.title: Today in history, December 27: Benazir Bhutto assasinated at election rally by teenage militant
item.description: During the tense campaign for her third term as prime minister of Pakistan, Benazir Bhutto survived one attempt on her life before she was shot dead by a teenage suicide bomber on December 27, 2007. She helped to build a political dynasty that continues.

item.title: Family unearths story of Australian cricket's 'girl Bradman' Hazel Pritchard
item.description: There was no central catalogue for the scattered histories of women's cricket. That may be about to change.

item.title: The 'Epstein Files' reveal how Ghislaine Maxwell helped pull young girls into a paedophile's web
item.description: The arts camp was prestigious, and "Jane" had travelled almost 2,500 kilometres to attend. As she sat by herself on a bench between classes, a man and a woman approached her.

item.title: England's soft underbelly exposed again as 20 Boxing Day wickets put MCG pitch in firing line
item.description: England's batters once again fall flat on their faces in the face of tricky conditions at the MCG for the Boxing Day Test.

item.title: A quick guide to the best fabrics and fibres for summer and their sustainability
item.description: What our clothes are made of can make a big difference when it comes to keeping cool, but not all fabrics are created equal. Here is what to look for — and avoid — during the warmer months.

item.title: 25 years on, the search continues for stars of the Sydney Olympics' closing ceremony
item.description: For Trevor Harvey, honouring a departed mate meant one thing — finding a 6-metre-tall Kewpie doll from the Sydney Olympics.

item.title: Sydney to Hobart race crews doing it tough in challenging conditions
item.description: Crews are battling sea sickness and tough conditions as teams head for the finish in the 2025 Sydney to Hobart yacht race.

item.title: Aboriginal community tension in Victoria's north amid health board division
item.description: An annual meeting to elect a new board at Mallee District Aboriginal Services has led to divisions among members and incoming board members as the chair announces elections will be re-run.

item.title: When green energy threatens what it is meant to save
item.description: In a tiny town near the Victoria–South Australia border, a proposed wind farm near a protected wetland is posing a big question for Australia's planning regulators.

item.title: BBL title-holders Hobart Hurricanes beat Perth Scorchers but lose Tim David to hamstring injury
item.description: Hobart's title defence suffers a huge blow after star batter Tim David injures his hamstring in his team's four-wicket win over the Scorchers.

item.title: The best vantage points and everything else you need to know about Sydney's New Year's Eve fireworks
item.description: Sydney's New Year's Eve celebrations will this year pay tribute to the victims of the Bondi terror attack, with events to feature a heavy police presence. Here is everything you need to know to plan your night.

item.title: South Australian playwright pays tribute to late partner in new production
item.description: An upcoming South Australian playwright was writing a horror, comedy show about the prospect of losing a much older partner, then it happened to him.

item.title: Australian medical history – the heart donor who still walks the earth 20 years later
item.description: Lucinda is a member of an exclusive club — living heart donors, and is the only woman to have a baby after a heart-lung-liver transplant

item.title: 13 long reads to catch up on for your summer holiday
item.description: Here we've gathered a bunch of other things to read while you're relaxing over summer.

item.title: Ladybirds set loose at Australian Parliament House in Canberra over summer to take out pests
item.description: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

item.title: 175-year-old Nor' West Bend Station reopened to public after decades of restoration work
item.description: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

item.title: Ashes 2025: England wins first Test in Australia in 5,468 days after two-day MCG match
item.description: England survives a nervy run chase to win its first Test match on Australian soil since 2011 in a manic two-day encounter in Melbourne.

item.title: Mosque blast during Friday noon prayers kills eight in Syria
item.description: The attack has been claimed by the ultra-conservative Sunni group Saraya Ansar al-Sunnah, which was also responsible for a Damascus church bombing in June.

item.title: Trio of retirees from Dongara win award for community rubbish collection
item.description: Armed with gloves, bags, buckets and tongs, a trio of passionate rubbish removalists have picked up an award in this regional Western Australia town.

item.title: Storm Hunter returns for the Australian summer targeting a top doubles ranking
item.description: Popular Australian Storm Hunter is back from injury and adamant she can return to the form that made her the world's top-ranked doubles player.

item.title: Australians are drinking less, but one cohort won't give up the booze
item.description: Health-conscious Australians may be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

item.title: These volunteer firefighters keep communities safe. Here's why
item.description: Volunteer firefighters put their lives on the line for their community, despite facing extreme situations, heightened health risks and constant exposure to traumatic events.

item.title: China hits US defence firms with sanctions over arms sales to Taiwan
item.description: China urged the US to "stop the dangerous moves of arming Taiwan" after its multi-billion-dollar sale of weapons last week.

item.title: Ukrainian capital Kyiv under Russian attack, officials say
item.description: Explosions have been heard, air defences are in operation and the military is on alert for impending missile attacks.

item.title: How a tsunami in Sri Lanka sparked a push to prevent drowning
item.description: What began as tsunami relief, has become something more powerful — teaching children not to fear the water that surrounds them.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire, ending weeks of clashes
item.description: The ceasefire will take effect on Saturday at noon local time, in a conflict which has displaced more than half a million people on both sides.

item.title: Urban water restrictions likely across Victoria as dam levels drop and dry summer predicted
item.description: Victoria's water storage levels have dropped to 61 per cent capacity after most of the state recorded below average rainfall in 2025.

item.title: Robots, AI and 'smart tourism' will change how we travel
item.description: Will new technology lead to streamlined service and stress-free travel, or will it fundamentally change tourism and tourist destinations?

item.description: Residents have begun returning to their homes after a bushfire burning south-east of Perth forced them to flee on Christmas Day.

item.title: Hobart family reunited with dog nearly four years after it disappeared from home
item.description: A blurry photo on social media has led to a Hobart family reuniting with their missing dog nearly four years after it vanished from their home.

item.title: Gus Atkinson injured and Marnus Labuschagne struggles again as Bazball pays off for England — five quick hits from day two of the Boxing Day Ashes Test
item.description: Bazball finally has its day in the Aussie sun as England's audacious tactics pay off despite another hit to its pace stocks. Here are the quick hits from day two at the MCG.

item.title: Australia belted, England vindicated and Test cricket wounded in MCG Ashes Test farce
item.description: As England deservedly celebrates a long-awaited Test win in Australia, everyone else involved counts the cost of a farcical and damaging two-day disaster at the MCG.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Calls for MCG Boxing Day Test pitch to be rated 'poor' as England and Australia batting criticised
item.description: After the first Test of the Ashes series sensationally ended in just two days, Cricket Australia hoped it wouldn't see that again for a century. It's happened again five weeks later.

item.description: Russia has attacked Ukraine with hundreds of missiles and drones ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said would be a crucial meeting with Donald Trump to work out a deal to end nearly four years of war.

item.description: On December 28, 1942, a US president formally approved an investment in the top-secret project to create nuclear weapons.

item.description: A rising number of Australians are using steroids. But one expert says a lack of knowledge and widespread stigma make it tough to get clinical support.

item.description: AI is becoming a regular presence at homework time in many Chinese households. Experts say where families draw the line matters more than the technology itself.

item.description: Crews have been battling challenging conditions, damage and sea sickness as the leading yachts are expected to arrive in Hobart later today.

item.title: Local Government Inspectorate closed years-long Hepburn Hub investigation without finishing report

item.title: What was on summer reading lists 100 years ago, in 1925?

item.description: Police say they responded to reports of a domestic assault at a home in South Australia's south-east on Saturday.

item.title: Taiwan's cunning tax compliance makes most shopping receipts a ticket in a lottery
item.description: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

item.title: Comanche takes out line honours in 2025 Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race — as it happened
item.description: Master Lock Comanche claims line honours in the 80th edition of the gruelling Sydney to Hobart yacht race, with a stunning daylight hours finish, making up for retiring early in last year's race.

item.title: Comanche wins Sydney to Hobart line honours
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, iconic French actor, sex symbol and animal rights campaigner, dies aged 91
item.description: The French actor and singer was a screen siren of the 1950s and 1960s who in later life became a prominent animal rights campaigner.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot was the world's 'sex kitten'. Her nonchalance was all French
item.description: Few epitomised French chic like Brigitte Bardot, the doe-eyed beauty whose sensuality rocked a post-war world.

item.title: Families of Bondi victims call for federal royal commission
item.description: Loved ones of those killed and injured in the Bondi Beach attack say rising antisemitism requires a "powerful national response", piling pressure on Anthony Albanese for a royal commission.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios defeats Aryna Sabalenka in latest 'battle of the sexes'
item.description: Australia's Nick Kyrgios defeated women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the latest "battle of the sexes". The Aussie, who has fallen outside the ATP top 600 after barely playing for three years, won 6-3, 6-3.

item.title: A growing number of older women surfers are showing age is just a state of mind
item.description: When Katie Pahlow turned 60, she decided to finally bite the bullet and book herself in for some surf lessons.

item.title: This week in history quiz, December 29: How well do you remember this week in history?
item.description: Test your knowledge with questions about Shane Warne, Frank Sinatra and Australia's first stamp.

item.title: Sarah Larcombe's journey back to the top of the paraclimbing world after devastating injuries
item.description: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

item.title: Aid agencies fear lifesaving program banned in Gaza under new Israeli requirements
item.description: The Israeli government has introduced new rules for aid organisations, including that they must not engage in any activities or criticism which "delegitimise" the state of Israel.

item.title: Inside Big Ben, a London icon that's been ringing since 1859
item.description: It's among the world's most photographed landmarks, a symbol of the United Kingdom and an engineering marvel. And for London's Big Ben the most important night of the year is fast approaching.

item.title: Furious customers slam ASIC for ignoring Zone RV whistleblower complaints before collapse
item.description: Anger is growing after revelations the corporate watchdog failed to investigate allegations against luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV.

item.title: Australia's driver courtesy wave dying out, say truckies, but experiment proves wave still alive on back roads
item.description: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

item.title: Overall winner yet to be decided as Sydney to Hobart yacht race enters fourth day
item.description: The yacht race has entered the fourth day, after Master Lock Comanche claimed line honours late on Sunday.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says progress made on peace deal, but Donald Trump says 'thorny issues' remain
item.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says a security guarantee between Ukraine and the US as part of a peace deal is "100 per cent agreed", while Donald Trump says there are still one or two "thorny issues" to finalise in the deal.

item.title: Concerns medical weight-loss treatments are being advertised to vulnerable eating disorder patients
item.description: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

item.title: Young women join Country Women's Association Sydney branch in droves
item.description: More young women are joining the Country Women's Association's city branches, with a passion for jams and scones along with social connection and purpose.

item.title: Dad and his boys stranded in outback after intense rain cuts roads
item.description: Intense rainfall across the north and west of Queensland is forecast to cause widespread flooding and damaging winds.

item.title: Voter turnout lower than expected in Myanmar's first election since 2020
item.description: Myanmar's election has been widely dismissed as a sham by many governments and human rights activists who have said the military will use proxy candidates to legitimise their rule.

item.title: Travis Head happy to see out Ashes as Australian opener before working out future role
item.description: Australia star Travis Head says he is not precious about continuing to open the batting beyond this Ashes and will bat wherever the coaches tell him to.

item.title: AI powered 2025's economy to record highs. So why are only robots smiling?
item.description: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

item.title: Deadly varroa mite threatens half of Canberra’s beehives
item.description: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ focused boxing class combatting loneliness amid warnings about social isolation
item.description: One in three adults experience social isolation in what experts say is a "dangerous" issue in society. One suburban boxing group is working to tackle the issue, focused on the LGBTQIA+ community more at risk of loneliness.

item.title: Cyclone Hayley upgraded to category two system, as northern WA residents told to prepare
item.description: Residents in WA's north are on alert following the formation of Tropical Cyclone Hayley off the coast overnight.

item.title: Wet season's arrival prompts moves to shore up food security in Far North Queensland
item.description: Earlier this year, a once-in-a-century flood devastated Ingham and cut the main supply route between Cairns and Townsville. Now, as intense rainfall once again triggers multiple warnings and floods roads across northern Queensland, communities are taking steps to prevent another food shortage.

item.title: How vintage black-and-white films are making a splash back in colour
item.description: Would those classic black-and-white films be the same if viewed in full colour?

item.title: Australian rowers targetting Los Angeles Olympics after breakthrough medal in coastal beach sprints
item.description: After claiming Australia's first world championship medal in rowing coastal beach sprints, these athletes are turning their attention towards the LA Olympics.

item.title: Victorian master builder transforms Warrnambool house into castle for his son
item.description: They say "a man's home is his castle," but one builder from south-west Victoria has taken that literally when creating a dream home for his son.

item.title: Mexico train crash kills passengers in country's south
item.description: Another five people are in a critical condition after the Interoceanic Train detailed in the southern state of Oaxana.

item.title: New search for missing woman Trisha Graf near Andamooka
item.description: Police say they have "grave concerns" for a woman who has not been seen for more than two weeks in outback South Australia.

item.title: NSW government sets up hub to assist those impacted by Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: The Bondi Hub will be open to the community and those directly or indirectly impacted by the December 14 shooting at the Chanukah by the Sea event at Bondi Beach, where 15 people were killed.

item.title: Australia coach Andrew McDonald says Usman Khawaja will play the final Ashes Test amid retirement speculation
item.description: Usman Khawaja will play in the Ashes finale at the SCG, but Australian coach Andrew McDonald remains in the dark about the 39-year-old's future beyond that.

item.title: Anthony Albanese announces terms for Richardson review of Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

item.title: 'Air experience' student killed in crash during Tasmanian glider's launch phase
item.description: A woman in her 50s was taking an "air experience" flight along with an instructor when they crashed during the take-off towing phase, as her husband watched.

item.title: NT police arrest woman for allegedly stealing from patients in Alice Springs Hospital
item.description: A 30-year-old woman faces court after allegedly stealing from multiple elderly patients recovering from surgery in Alice Springs Hospital over an extended period.

item.title: Coolongolook Rural Fire Service volunteers 'gutted' after robbery during fire season
item.description: The volunteers discovered the theft when they arrived at the Coolongolook RFS shed to attend a car crash. Thieves stole hoses, breathing masks, radios and chainsaws.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston dies from cancer complications, aged 52
item.description: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston has died from complications associated with cancer, aged 52.

item.title: England's pace bowling stocks stripped bare with Gus Atkinson out of SCG Test
item.description: England's pace bowling stocks will be stretched to their absolute limit for the final Ashes Test with Gus Atkinson ruled out with a hamstring injury.

item.title: Bondi hero recounts how he disarmed one of the gunmen
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ahmed Al Ahmed recounts how he disarmed one of the gunmen in Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

item.title: The right way to stack your dishwasher and the verdict on rinsing beforehand
item.description: Rinsing can actually send a message to your dishwasher that your plate doesn't need as much washing.

item.title: Celebrating New Year's Eve in Melbourne? Here's how and where to bring in 2026
item.description: Half a million people are expected in the CBD as Melbourne farewells 2025 and ushers in 2026.

item.title: Swan Hill tobacco shop rammed in failed firebomb attempt as tobacco wars continue
item.description: A tobacco shop is rammed with a vehicle weeks after receiving a shakedown note demanding the owner "contact the commission".

item.title: Stranded passengers to fly home from PNG after failed efforts to free Coral Adventurer
item.description: Passengers on the Australian cruise ship stranded off the coast of Papua New Guinea will be flown out of the country after efforts to refloat the vessel failed.

item.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride to remain in custody for next seven days
item.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride will spend the next week in custody, after being arrested and charged over the weekend.

item.title: China launches military exercise warning against Taiwan independence
item.description: China has moved its military to surround Taiwan warning against its independence. But Beijing's action has been condemned by Taiwan calling for regional peace and de-escalation.

item.title: 'Punishing seaway' pushes Sydney to Hobart sailors to their limits
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sydney to Hobart competitors tell of 'horrendous' conditions during 2025 race ordeal
item.description: Those now safely onshore after finishing the 2025 Sydney to Hobart tell of "horrendous" conditions, resulting in injuries, broken boats and seasickness — even among experienced crew members.

item.title: Prosecutors wrap up bribery investigation into South Korea's former first lady
item.description: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of disgraced ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol, is alleged to have accepted lavish bribes including fine art, jewellery and designer handbags, and to have meddled in state affairs.

item.title: Kempsey community marks 10 years since death in custody of David Dungay Jr
item.description: A decade after his death in a Sydney prison, David Dungay Jr's family hold with a memorial rally calling for change to a corrections system they say still fails to protect Indigenous people.

item.title: Man fights for life after sustaining critical burns in Cairns unit fire
item.description: A man has sustained life-threatening burns after a unit complex went up in flames in Cairns. Police continue to investigate the cause of the fire.

item.title: Slow TV for kids: Relax and unwind with low-stimulation shows on ABC iview
item.description: Looking for screen-time options that won't leave your kids overstimulated? 'Slow TV' shows, with their soothing visuals and soundtracks, could be the answer.

item.title: Boat fire at Bonnie Doon leaves two men with serious injuries
item.description: Emergency services were on Monday called to a Lake Eildon boat ramp where two men had sustained serious injuries in a fire.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Sydney Test a golden opportunity for Cameron Green to belatedly shine in Australia
item.description: He has already proven his quality away from home, but heading into the final Test of the Ashes summer, Cameron Green remains in search of his breakthrough moment in Australia.

item.title: Legal loophole in Queensland's double jeopardy law closed
item.description: Last-minute amendments to Queensland's double jeopardy laws could allow for the retrial of botched DNA cases.

item.title: Australia is considered a "lifeboat" region for some threatened rhino ray species, but the numbers worldwide are grim.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man faces court over alleged Boxing Day murder in remote NT community
item.description: A 39-year-old man appears in court charged with the stabbing murder of a man in a remote Northern Territory community north of Alice Springs.

item.title: Dozens of shark heads dumped outside WA Fisheries minister's office as demersal fishing ban looms
item.description: Hundreds of kilograms of shark heads have been left dumped outside the WA Fisheries minister's office in Margaret River, just three days before a permanent commercial demersal fishing ban comes into effect.

item.title: Menorah to light up Sydney Harbour Bridge on New Year's Eve after open letter from Jewish creatives
item.description: More than 30 Jewish-Australian creatives wrote to Lord Mayor Clover Moore on Monday morning, urging for a "Jewish-specific symbol" to commemorate the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attacks.

item.title: ICC gives MCG pitch 'unsatisfactory' rating as two-day Test fallout continues
item.description: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

item.title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaching ceasefire deal after 250 drones flown over border
item.description: Bangkok has accused Phnom Penh of violating the peace deal that was struck on Saturday, after it claimed some 250 drones had been flown over the disputed border region.
